result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina Joy Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow up at discretion of probation officer

AODA and follow up at discretion of probation officer

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina Joy Roberts

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christina Joy Roberts in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson. Jill Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF232, 13TR1242, 13TR1255 @ 2:00 p.m. County moves to dismiss 13TR1242 and 13TR1255. Court grants. 15CF232 - agreement stated: Def will plead to ct 4  amended to misd bail jumping 946.49(1)(a),  and to ct 5, cts 1, 2, & 3 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 18 months probation, court costs, AODA and follow up treatment as recommended. Atty Nelson agrees, will address treatment at sentencing. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants motion to amend ct 4 to misd bail jumping. Guilty plea. Plea to ct 5 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 1, 2 & 3. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Nelson satisfied. Statement by Atty Nelson. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of ct 4 misd bail jumping and ct 5 obstructing an officer. No victim rights issues. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. Ct 4 - withheld sentence, 18 months probation, Court will leave AODA and follow up to probation officer's discretion, court costs, DNA surcharge (sample already done). No credit if revoked. Ct 5 - sentence withheld, 18 months probation, court costs, DNA surcharge, AODA to discretion of P.O. Apply bond.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Probation is concurrent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christina Joy Roberts in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CF228 @ 11:16 a.m. Both Counsel have received PSI report. No additions or corrections from State. No factual corrections by Def. State heard on sentencing, recommends withheld sentence, probation, 90 days jail w/huber, compile formal apology to Dep. Carter. Atty Nelson gives sentencing arguments, asks withheld sentence, 18 months probation concurrent on all counts. Statement by Def. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court orders on ct 2 - 12 months probation, court costs, no DNA surcharge. Ct 1-  18 months probation, withheld prison sentence,court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 60 days jail, report no later than 6 p.m. on 6/25/16, huber for employment or childcare as allowed. Ct 3 - 12 months probation, concurrent, 60 days jail, concurrent to ct 1. All probation concurrent. Court costs, huber same as ct 1. Court will not order letter of apology, leaves up to Def. Court clarifies - withheld sentence on each ct. Discussion regarding credit for time served. Court will reserve credit for time served if revoked. Further discussion.  Atty Nelson will prepare stipulation on credit if revoked. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Bond of $2100 to be applied to costs, return any balance to poster(s). $500 of bond to cover 15CF232.  
15CF232 called @ 12:20. Def has copy of information, reading waived. Not guilty pleas. Court accepts and enters not guilty pleas. Status conference 6/20/16 @ 3:30 p.m. Def does not have to be present but advised to stay in contact with atty. Bond remains.

Defendant Christina Joy Roberts in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:43 p.m. Sgt. Greg Carter duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. State moves for bind over. Arguments by counsel. Court binds over. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all juris. objections. Statement by Atty Bennett regarding possible substitution/recusal. Statement by the Court. Response by Atty Bennett. Bond remains. 
  Arraignment scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without valid prescription.

Defendant Christina Joy Roberts in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Christina Joy Roberts in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Def has another case pending.  Bond recommendations.  Family indicates they can post $1000.00  Bond arguments by State.  Court gives statement in regards to bond.  Bond set by court.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing within 20 days.  Def wants hearing within 20 days.  Court explains again right to preliminary within time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
